modules.description: Provides functions to construct and modify choice options, including creating a choice with a character, value, and label, and setting a default option. Works with a parameterized type that holds a character, value, and string label. Used to manage user selections in command-line interfaces or configuration menus.

Provides functions to execute asynchronous tasks with structured logging of start and completion messages, ensuring proper output ordering during parallel execution. Works with asynchronous deferred values and format strings to generate process-specific logs. Used to track the lifecycle of concurrent operations like background data processing or system tasks.

Provides asynchronous input handling and event loop integration for interactive applications. Processes user input and system events using non-blocking I/O operations. Enables real-time response to keyboard and signal events in command-line tools.

manages user choices and asynchronous operations through parameterized types and logging mechanisms. It supports creating and modifying selectable options with characters, values, and labels, and executes async tasks while logging their progress. Users can build interactive menus and track concurrent processes with precise output control. For example, it can handle a configuration prompt with labeled options and log the completion of parallel data fetches.
